page.title: 07FARMING
page.content: High Barns Farm,Ovingham,is typical of the area.More unusual is the large dairy farm at Wylam. Mr Bramwell lives at High Barns Farm,which is one of two which he farms,although it is actually owned by Lord Allendale.Men are employed on the two farms with their own jobs to do.These include milking the cows,mucking out and feeding the stock and managing the machines.The livestock consists of Limousin and Fresian which are usually kept for four of five years and then sold. The land is used for grazing and crops.The main crop that is grown is barley.On the farm there are four tractors,a combine harvester and a grain dryer.
